intro: Barleria caudata, commonly known as the spurred barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or red. These flowers are often adorned with prominent spurred extensions, which are characteristic of the genus Barleria. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
